xxl.core.cursors.sources.io
Class FileInputCursor<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.InputStreamCursor<E>
          xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.FileInputCursor<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements read from the underlying file.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<E>, Cursor<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
KPEInputCursor, PointInputCursor, RectangleInputIterator
public class FileInputCursor<E>
extends InputStreamCursor<E>

This class provides a cursor that depends on a given file. It iterates over the objects that are read out of the underlying file. A converter is used in order to read out the serialized objects. This class implements only a few constructors. These constructers create a new input stream cursor that depends on a file input stream.

Example usage (1): 

   // create a new file

   File file = new File("file.dat");

   // catch IOExceptions

   try {

       // create a random access file on that file

       RandomAccessFile output = new RandomAccessFile(file, "rw");

       // write some data to that file

       output.writeUTF("Some data.");
       output.writeUTF("More data.");
       output.writeUTF("Another bundle of data.");
       output.writeUTF("A last bundle of data.");

       // close the random access file

       output.close();
   }
   catch (Exception e) {
       System.out.println("An error occured.");
   }

   // create a new file input cursor with ...

   FileInputCursor<String> cursor = new FileInputCursor<String>(

       // a string converter

       StringConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE,

       // the created file

       file
   );
 
   // open the cursor
 
   cursor.open();

   // print all elements of the cursor

   while (cursor.hasNext())
       System.out.println(cursor.next());
 
   // close the cursor
 
   cursor.close();

   // delete the file

   file.delete();

See Also:
Iterator, Cursor, InputStreamCursor, File

Constructor Detail

FileInputCursor

public FileInputCursor(Converter<? extends E> converter,
                       File file,
                       int bufferSize)
Constructs a new file-input cursor that depends on the specified file and uses the specified converter in order to read out the serialized objects. An internal buffer of size bufferSize is used for the file input.

Parameters:
converter - the converter that is used for reading out the serialized objects of this iteration.
file - the file that contains the serialized objects of this iteration.
bufferSize - the size of the buffer that is used for the file input.

FileInputCursor

public FileInputCursor(Converter<? extends E> converter,
                       File file)
Constructs a new file-input cursor that depends on the specified file and uses the specified converter in order to read out the serialized objects. This constructor is equivalent to the call of 
   new FileInputIterator(converter, file, 4096)
.

Parameters:
converter - the converter that is used for reading out the serialized objects of this iteration.
file - the file that contains the serialized objects of this iteration.
Method Detail

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
